fields.description:
When you try to find out how to use Arrow from a third-party project, you may read the comments in FindArrow.cmake:
{code}
# This module defines
#  ARROW_FOUND, whether Arrow has been found
#  ARROW_FULL_SO_VERSION, full shared object version of found Arrow "100.0.0"
#  ARROW_IMPORT_LIB, path to libarrow's import library (Windows only)
#  ARROW_INCLUDE_DIR, directory containing headers
#  ARROW_LIBS, deprecated. Use ARROW_LIB_DIR instead
#  ARROW_LIB_DIR, directory containing Arrow libraries
#  ARROW_SHARED_IMP_LIB, deprecated. Use ARROW_IMPORT_LIB instead
#  ARROW_SHARED_LIB, path to libarrow's shared library
#  ARROW_SO_VERSION, shared object version of found Arrow such as "100"
#  ARROW_STATIC_LIB, path to libarrow.a
#  ARROW_VERSION, version of found Arrow
#  ARROW_VERSION_MAJOR, major version of found Arrow
#  ARROW_VERSION_MINOR, minor version of found Arrow
#  ARROW_VERSION_PATCH, patch version of found Arrow
{code}

... only to find out that {{find_package(Arrow)}} doesn't set most of those variables:
* it sets {{Arrow_FOUND}}, not {{ARROW_FOUND}}
* {{ARROW_INCLUDE_DIR}}, {{ARROW_SHARED_LIB}}, {{ARROW_STATIC_LIB}} are not set
* to link with Arrow C++, you have to link with either {{arrow_shared}} or {{arrow_static}}

Also, I wonder if Arrow should follow the more recent convention of naming its targets e.g. {{Arrow::Arrow}} or {{arrow::arrow}} (or specifically {{arrow::shared}}).

comments.body:
I agree that we need to update the comments.

For {{ARROW_INCLUDE_DIR}}, it must be set. If it isn't set, {{find_package(Arrow)}} must be failed because we specify it as a  variable of {{REQUIRED_VARS}} for {{find_package_handle_standard_args}}: https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/cmake_modules/FindArrow.cmake#L416

For target names, I like {{arrow::arrow}} if we can unify {{arrow::arrow_shared}} and {{arrow::arrow_static}}. If we can't unify them, I like {{arrow::arrow_shared}} and {{arrow::arrow_static}}.
We may should rename {{ARROW_*}} to {{Arrow_*}} to follow CMake convention.
Do we want to change anything for 1.0.0?

I think that we should work on this for 1.0.0 because it may break backward compatibility.
But I will not have enough time to work on this for 1.0.0...
Okay, [~apitrou] or [~uwe] what do you think?
Well, the comments at least should be fixed. I can try to do it, though I fear only Kou and Uwe really understand what this all does ;-)
I can take care of this. I agree that we should change to Arrow case and. Also we should change the targets to Arrow::Arrow, Arrow::Compute,...
[~uwe] do you think this is still possible for 1.0.0?
It seems this change may not make 1.0.0. I moved out of the milestone for now
I would be able to squeeze this in but I have the feeling that this might break some downstream users again and thus lead to delays in the release process, so delaying it shortly after the release.

[~kou] It would probably be worthwhile cleaning up our own FindXXX files and making them easier to use/understand.

(perhaps even switch to more modern CMake conventions if they exist?)

I think so too. :-)
I want to do this in ARROW-12175 but I didn't have time to do this.
But I will have time to do this for 9.0.0.
ARROW-12175 / https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13892 changes {{arrow_shared}} to {{Arrow::arrow_shared}} and removes all our {{Find*.cmake}}.
